alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 10 at 2:41AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN ROOSEVELT AND NORTHEASTERN CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 330 AM MDT... At 240 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms 9 miles southwest of Pep, or 28 miles south of Portales, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elida, Dora, Causey, Milnesand, Lingo and Pep. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
